de.unlixx.runpng

Class AppFramesView

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.control.Control
            • javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane
              • de.unlixx.runpng.AppFramesView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.scene.control.Skinnable

    public class AppFramesView
extends javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane
    Implements an AppFramesView in order to show and manage a sequence of images. This class derives from ScrollPane and creates a FramesBox to store the images in FramePane containers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • setAdjusting

        public void setAdjusting(boolean bAdjusting)
        Sets the adjusting flag in order to don't start actions caused by adjusting operations.
        Parameters:
        bAdjusting - True if the following operations shall be ignored by change listeners and similar.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all FramePanes from the FramesBox content.

      • appSizeChanged

        void appSizeChanged(int nWidth,
                    int nHeight)
        Called by the application in case of an app image size change. It dispatches the new sizes to all FramePanes.
        Parameters:
        nWidth - The new image width.
        nHeight - The new image height.

        Validates menu items if needed.
        Parameters:

      • addPngFile

        public void addPngFile(int nAfterIndex)
        Adds a png file after the given index. This can be a single image or a whole image sequence.
        Parameters:
        nAfterIndex - The index after the png file will be inserted.

      • removeFrame

        public void removeFrame(FramePane pane)
        Removes a single FramePane from the FramesBox.
        Parameters:
        pane - A FramePane container object.

      • duplicateFrame

        public FramePane duplicateFrame(FramePane pane)
        Duplicates the given FramePane and inserts it directly after the original.
        Parameters:
        pane - A FramePane object to duplicate.
        Returns:
        The new created FramePane.

      • createFrame

        public FramePane createFrame(javafx.scene.image.Image image,
                             int nIdx,
                             PngDelayFraction fraction,
                             UndoableCollection coll)
        Creates a new FramePane and inserts it at the given index.
        Parameters:
        image - The Image object for the new FramePane.
        nIdx - An integer containing the index where the new FramePane will be inserted. If < 0 then it will be added at the end.
        fraction - The PngDelayFraction object, needed to show and host the delay time.
        coll - The UndoableCollection to list and manage an Undoable for this FramePane creation. If the collection is null then no undo is possible.
        Returns:
        The new created FramePane object.

      • getFramesCount

        public int getFramesCount()
        Gets the current number of FramePanes managed.
        Returns:
        An int containing the number of FramePanes.

      • getSelectedIndex

        public int getSelectedIndex()
        Gets the currently selected index.
        Returns:
        An int containing the index of the selected FramePane. Or -1 if none is selected.

      • setSelectedIndex

        public FramePane setSelectedIndex(int nIdx)
        Sets the currently selection index.
        Parameters:
        nIdx - An int containing the index of the selected FramePane.
        Returns:
        A FramePane object. Or null if the index is out of bounds.

      • getFrame

        public FramePane getFrame(int nIdx)
        Gets a FramePane at the given index.
        Parameters:
        nIdx - The index of the pane to get.
        Returns:
        A FramePane object.

      • getSelectedFrame

        public FramePane getSelectedFrame()
        Gets the currently selected FramePane.
        Returns:
        A FramePane object. Or null if none is selected.

      • scrollIntoView

        public void scrollIntoView(FramePane pane)
        Scrolls the given FramePane into the visible part of the viewport. If the FramePane is already completely shown in the viewport then this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        pane - A FramePane object.

      • createSequence

        public Bitmap32Sequence createSequence(javafx.scene.image.Image image)
        Creates a Bitmap32Sequence from a given single Image object.
        Parameters:
        image - An Image object.
        Returns:
        The Bitmap32Sequence object.

      • createSequence

        public Bitmap32Sequence createSequence(boolean bBase,
                                       boolean bOptimize,
                                       boolean bAll)
        Creates a Bitmap32Sequence from the stored base images or from the view images. 
         See also FramePane.FramePane(Image, PngDelayFraction) regarding base and view images.
        Parameters:
        bBase - True if the Bitmap32Sequence has to be created from base images.
        bOptimize - True if the Bitmap32Sequence shall be optimized for png saving.
        bAll - True if all frames must be collected. Regardless of the animation type.
        Returns:
        The Bitmap32Sequence object.

      • applyBitmapSequence

        public void applyBitmapSequence(Bitmap32Sequence sequence,
                                boolean bFirst)
        Applies a Bitmap32Sequence to this view. Which can be the first sequence or an additional.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The Bitmap32Sequence object to apply.
        bFirst - True if the apply shall start from scratch.

      • applyBitmapSequence

        int applyBitmapSequence(Bitmap32Sequence sequence,
                        boolean bIgnoreAnim,
                        int nAtIndex,
                        UndoableCollection coll)
        Internally used method to add the bitmap Bitmap32Sequence(s).
        Parameters:
        sequence - The Bitmap32Sequence object to apply.
        bIgnoreAnim - True if the animation control of the sequence shall be ignored.
        nAtIndex - The index where to insert the sequence.
        coll - The UndoableCollection to list and manage the Undoable object(s).
        Returns:
        An int containing the index where the given sequence has been inserted.

      • applyViewsSequence

        public void applyViewsSequence(Bitmap32Sequence sequence)
        Applies a sequence of views for the existing frame panes. This method has been created for palette optimization and should not be used for other purposes.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The Bitmap32Sequence object containing the new view images.

      • collectProject

        public void collectProject(PngProject project)
        Collects the data of this view in the given PngProject object.
        Parameters:
        project - A PngProject object.

      • applyProject

        public void applyProject(PngProject project)
        Applies data from a PngProject object.
        Parameters:
        project - A PngProject object.
